# 28/30 lunar mansions ğ“‰” ğ“‰§ Manazilu Ê¾l-Qamar

28 â‰ˆ Sidereal month  27 d  7 h 43 min  
30 â‰ˆ Synodic month   29 d 12 h 44 min  

[lunar mansions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lunar_station#Stations_in_different_cultures)  

28 [Zodiac](Zodiac.html)s  
28 â‰ˆ äºŒåå…«å®¿  ÃˆrshÃ­bÄ XiÃ¹  

30 = 3 x 10 three [deccan](deccan.html)s vs  
28 = 3 x 9 + 1 pseudo decimal system of the [Ennead](Ennead.html)  
28 = 4 x 7 [week](week.html)s of seven [day](day.html)s:  

ğ“Š ğ“Šª ğ“‡¹ | one seventh (of a cubit) | 1/7 sept Ï£â²Ÿâ²¡ Ï£â²±â²¡ 1/7=4/28 4-finger breadth "palm"  

The Sidereal month was at times connected to a 3*9(+1) numbering scheme strongly connected with first millennium BC alphabets:  

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyrillic_numerals

The Greek alphabet and number system is almost related to the first rod except for the extra entry ğ“¹ğ“Œ´ğ“ˆ–ğ“ğ“†‘ between 90 and 100. This is a general problem: we have 27 numbers but 28 days! The second rod is from a side branch in the development of the alphabet dissimilar to greek. The first sifted letters might be explainable, the ğ“… ğ“…® part much less so.

# [Halaham](Halaham.html)
The 28 cubit on old Egyptian measuring rods were previously assumed to represent or connect to some form of ancient Alphabet.

It is weakly compatible with the ğ“€  ğ“² ğ“‡“ ğ“ˆ– Harashamun form of the [Halaham](Halaham.html) :
